mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Burwell Bassett, 1773 June 20
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "It is an easier matter to conceive than to describe, the distress of this family; especially that of the unhappy parent of our dear Patsy Custis, when I inform you that yesterday removed the sweet Innocent girl into a more happy and peaceful abode than any she has met with in the affected path she hitherto has trod." Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, with cover and partial seal.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Custis family
